name: Scholar
description: Your life was spent in study, poring over scrolls, learning from sages, and unraveling mysteries.

feature.name: Researcher
feature.description: When you attempt to learn or recall a piece of lore, if you do not know that information, you often know where and from whom you can obtain it. Usually, this information comes from a library, scriptorium, university, or a sage.

traits.text: I quote obscure facts at every opportunity.
I use polysyllabic words that convey the impression of great erudition.
I am absent-minded and easily distracted by new information.
I am patient and methodical in all things.
I am convinced that people are always trying to steal my secrets.
I am condescending to those who lack my education.
I have read about everything but experienced little.
I speak slowly, choosing my words with great care.

ideals.text: Knowledge. Truth must be pursued regardless of cost.
Logic. Emotions must not cloud our logical thinking.
Power. Knowledge is the path to power and domination.
Self-Improvement. The goal of a life of study is the betterment of oneself.
Sharing. Knowledge must be shared freely.
Beauty. The elegant solution is always the best.

bonds.text: I seek an ancient text that holds great secrets.
My library is my greatest treasure.
I owe everything to my institution.
I work to preserve endangered knowledge.
It is my duty to protect my students.

flaws.text: I hoard knowledge and refuse to share.
I am easily distracted by the promise of information.
I overlook obvious solutions in favor of complicated ones.
I speak without thinking, often insulting others.
I cannot keep a secret if it relates to my studies.
Most people scream and run when they see a demon. I stop and take notes.
